metadata.Title: CVE-2022-46874 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A file with a long filename could have had its filename truncated to removethe valid extension, leaving a malicious extension in its place. This couldpotentially led to user confusion and the execution of maliciouscode.
*Note*: This issue was originally included in the advisories forThunderbird 102.6, but a patch (specific to Thunderbird) was omitted,resulting in it actually being fixed in Thunderbird 102.6.1. Thisvulnerability affects Firefox < 108, Thunderbird < 102.6.1, Thunderbird <102.6, and Firefox ESR < 102.6.

criterions.comment: firefox: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
thunderbird: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
